extracted_lists: Nadis: Energy channels (72,000 in some accounts), with three primary: ida (lunar, left), pingala (solar, right), and sushumna (central)
Kundalini: The dormant spiritual energy coiled at the base of the spine, awakened through practice
Bindu: Points of concentrated consciousness, particularly at the third eye and crown
Granthis: Psychic "knots" that block kundalini's rise - brahma granthi (survival), vishnu granthi (emotion), rudra granthi (intellect)
Ultimate reality: Shiva-Shakti or Brahman as conscious, dynamic absolute
Goal: Recognition of one's identity with Shiva/divine consciousness
Deities: Shiva, Shakti forms (Kali, Durga, Tripura Sundari), Vishnu, etc.
Major traditions: Kashmir Shaivism, Sri Vidya, Kaula, various Shakta schools
Texts: Agamas, Tantras, Samhitas (thousands of texts)
Practice emphasis: Kundalini yoga, chakra work, mantra, ritual worship
Body: Temple of the divine; to be purified and divinized
Ultimate reality: Sunyata (emptiness) as the nature of all phenomena
Goal: Buddhahood - full enlightenment for benefit of all beings
Deities: Buddhas, bodhisattvas, dharmapalas, dakinis - understood as aspects of mind
Major traditions: Nyingma, Kagyu, Sakya, Gelug (Tibetan); Shingon (Japanese)
Texts: Buddhist Tantras (classified in four or six classes)
Practice emphasis: Deity yoga, guru yoga, completion stage practices
Body: Illusory but useful; transformed through visualization into buddha body
Kriya Tantra: Emphasis on external ritual, purity, and relating to deity as external lord
Charya Tantra: Balance of external ritual and internal meditation; deity as friend
Yoga Tantra: Emphasis on internal yoga; visualizing oneself as deity; deity as self
Anuttarayoga Tantra: Highest yoga; generation and completion stages; working with subtle energies
Yoga: Physical and energetic practices forming tantric foundation; hatha yoga arose from tantric context
Meditation: Various dhyana techniques central to tantric practice
Mantra: Sacred sound as primary tantric technology
Mandala: Sacred geometric representations of enlightened mind
Puja: Ritual worship integrating tantric elements
Deity Yoga: Buddhist practice of visualizing oneself as enlightened being
